meanings.definition: To inhabit or live in (a place)
meanings.sent1: Many birds populate the trees in the park.
meanings.sent2: People populate the bustling city streets every day.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to populate the picnic area, much to the surprise of the picnickers.
meanings.sent4: The idea began to populate her mind like a field of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bustling city streets, populated with cars and pedestrians, stayed with him.

meanings.definition: To fill with inhabitants or people
meanings.sent1: The new housing development will populate the once empty field.
meanings.sent2: The settlers worked hard to populate the new town with families.
meanings.sent3: The children's game of tag quickly turned into a race to populate the safe zone.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was populated with joy upon seeing her loved ones after a long time.
meanings.sent5: The library was populated with eager readers on the first day of the book sale.

meanings.sent1: The government aims to populate the rural areas with more healthcare facilities.
meanings.sent2: The landlord promised to populate the apartment complex with friendly tenants.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to magically populate with colorful scarves every time he reached inside.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to populate the room with a sense of calm and understanding.
meanings.sent5: The garden was populated with fragrant flowers that attracted butterflies and bees.
